name: Stay Over Program
description: Mission Action offers the Stay-over Program to San Francisco Unified School District students and their families who are experiencing homelessness. - Spanish interpretation services are available. Eligibility: - At least one student must be attending San Francisco K-12 public schools (not including charter or private schools). How to Apply: - Ask about availability by calling either: - Office phone line, 8AM to 6PM: 628-215-2080 - Shelter phone line, 6:30PM to 7AM: 415-879-4316 Open Hours: - Mon
fullDescription: Mission Action offers the Stay-over Program to San Francisco Unified School District students and their families who are experiencing homelessness. - Spanish interpretation services are available. whatTheyOffer: Mission Action offers the Stay-over Program to San Francisco Unified School District students and their families who are experiencing homelessness. - Spanish interpretation services are available. Eligibility: - At least one student must be attending San Francisco K-12 public schools (not including charter or private schools). How to Apply: - Ask about availability by calling either: - Office phone line, 8AM to 6PM: 628-215-2080 - Shelter phone line, 6:30PM to 7AM: 415-879-4316 Open Hours: - Mon
howToGetIt: The program serves families who have at least one student in the San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) and is open from 7 a.m.-7 p.m. Monday through Friday and 24 hours Saturday, Sunday, and SFUSD Holidays. To inquire about availability, please contact: (628)215-2080 (Office Line 9 am-5 pm) or (415) 879-4316 (Shelter Line 7 pm-7 am).
keywords: we are a family with children under 18 years old.
agency: Mission Action (formerly Dolores Street Community Services)
